Patch Set 1:

Saw your request for help on this in #openstack-infra an hour or so ago. It looks like this is consistently failing unit tests the same way... an "image not found" exception coming back from an API call. Could be related to this patch, or could be a bad test exposed by the changes made in this patch (would have to be answered by someone with more background in Glance than I have).
Uploaded patch set 2.

Thanks for your review.
This is a bug fix because, test_db_api.py, does not set the use_tpool option back to False, which results in failures of tests.
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Sorry for the -1, but could you please explain why we really need this? Since IMHO, functional test has the different scenarios from the way running Glance in a product env. In other words, user may configure the Glance with different databases in their product environment. But for functional tests, we clearly know what the db api we want to test. So I don't think the change is necessary though I think it works fine.

Patch Set 3:

Wang,

Please take a look at https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1221037.
I thought we could catch such bugs if we made this change.

Patch Set 3:

Yep, I noticed that. But as I said, if you want to cover a specific scenario, you may need add a new test case instead of just invoking the code which you want to test.

Patch Set 3:

I mean the change of the get_db method for different backends.

Patch Set 3:

Why I think this is necessary is because, we need to have our functional tests use the db_api modules like how it's used in a controller.

Patch Set 3:

My point is that we should as far as possible avoid importing the db_api modules and let get_api method handle it.

Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ok, thanks for the clarification. It makes more sense.
Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve
Uploaded patch set 4.
